data.title: The climate of Switzerland and the best time to visit
data.meta_description: Discover the climate of Switzerland. Read about average temperatures, precipitation, and the ideal months to visit.
data.text:
What’s the climate like in Switzerland?

The current climate in Switzerland features temperatures ranging from a high of 25°C to a low of 4°C throughout the year. The average yearly temperature is around 15°C. At night, temperatures in the colder months average around -2°C and in the warmer months around 14°C.

The highest temperature recorded in Switzerland in recent years was 35°C in August 2015. The lowest daytime temperature recorded was -7°C in February 2018.

On average, Switzerland gets 1143 mm of precipitation each year. Of this, about 98 cm is snowfall. For comparison, New York gets 862 mm of precipitation each year.

The climate of Switzerland is based on weather data from Bern. Other locations might vary.

Climate Table of Switzerland

The climate table of Switzerland shows the average temperatures, rainfall, snow, and UV index per month. The table provides an overview of the average day and night temperatures in degrees Celsius, the total amount of rainfall in millimeters, the total snowfall in centimeters, and the UV index for each month. Rainfall is always measured as water, even if it's snow or hail.

Jan Feb Mar Apr May Jun Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec Temp. max (°C) 4 7 10 14 18 24 25 24 19 15 8 5 Temp. min (°C) -2 -1 1 4 8 13 14 14 10 7 3 0 Precipitation Precipitation (mm) 99 66 66 75 122 128 127 106 74 87 81 112 Snow (cm) 28 13 12 8,5 1,0 0 0 0 0 2,1 7,4 26 UV Index 3 4 5 7 7 8 8 7 6 5 3 2

Click on the month name to see more weather details, like daily averages, temperatures, and precipitation for the past years in that month.

Average yearly temperature: 15°C

Highest temperature: 25°C in July

Lowest temperature: 4°C in January

Precipitation*: 1143 mm per year, averaging 95 mm per month

Snowfall: 98 cm per year

Driest months: 66 mm in February, March and 74 mm in September

Wettest months: 128 mm in June, 127 mm in July and 122 mm in May

*Precipitation is measured as a combination of rain, snow, and hail

Popular destinations in Switzerland

Average Temperature per Month in Switzerland

This graph shows the average maximum temperatures per month in Switzerland. The temperatures are shown in degrees Celsius and the average is calculated based on the recorded temperatures per month from past years.

Average Precipitation per Month in Switzerland

This graph shows how much rainfall Switzerland gets on average per month. Rainfall is always measured as water, even if it's snow or hail. This makes it easy to compare how much has fallen, regardless of the form of precipitation. The amount of rainfall is measured in millimeters, and the average is calculated based on the recorded rainfall per month from past years.

Average Snowfall per Month in Switzerland

This graph shows how much snow Switzerland gets on average per month. The amount of snowfall is measured in centimeters and the average is calculated based on the recorded snowfall per month from past years.

Average UV Index per Month in Switzerland

This graph shows the average UV index per month in Switzerland. The UV index indicates the intensity of ultraviolet radiation and ranges from 0 to a maximum of 11.

Yearly Temperature in Switzerland

This graph shows the average yearly temperature in Switzerland. The yearly temperature, expressed in degrees Celsius, is the average of all twelve monthly temperatures summed up for that year.

Total Yearly Precipitation in Switzerland

This chart shows the total yearly precipitation in Switzerland over the past few years. The total yearly precipitation, measured in millimeters, is the sum of all the rain that fell in the twelve months of that year.

Total Yearly Snowfall in Switzerland

This chart shows the total yearly snowfall in Switzerland over the past few years. The total yearly snowfall, measured in centimeters, is the sum of all the snow that fell in the twelve months of that year.
